issues.title: Workflows are not getting executed (both Email and specially Text message workflows)
issues.body:
Found a bug? Please fill out the sections below. 👍

### Issue Summary

The workflows are not working at all! The initial email works, but no other emails do. And for text message workflows, no text workflows work AT ALL! And yes, I know the event should be booked for at least 1 hour for this to execute. I have made sure there's enough time for the meeting. And yes, I am on the team plan as well.

This is extremely frustrating and is making me consider going back to Calendly, as I never had this major issue with them. If the workflows do not work, I close no clients. It's a massive bug that needs fixing and fast!

Any other relevant information. For example, why do you consider this a bug and what did you expect to happen instead?

### Actual Results

The booker is receiving the email confirmation and the first email from my sequence. But no other workflows are being executed.

### Expected Results

All my bookers should receive automated text and email reminders.

### Technical details

- Browser version, screen recording, console logs, network requests: You can make a recording with [Bird Eats Bug](https://birdeatsbug.com/).
- Node.js version
- Anything else that you think could be an issue.

### Evidence

- I spoke about this with Milos from the support team and shared my screen to explain this, and he also thinks this is a bug as he himself tried booking a call, and the workflows simply did not execute.

issues.title: Redirect to sign up page before accepting scheduled meetings
issues.body:
**Issue Summary**
The meeting link is included in the confirmation email but is missing from reminder emails. This inconsistency creates confusion for users, as they rely on reminders for last-minute access to meeting details.

**Steps to Reproduce**
- Schedule a meeting via cal.com.
- Receive the confirmation email with the meeting link (works as expected).
- Wait for the reminder email sent closer to the meeting time.
- Notice that the reminder email does not include the meeting link.
**Actual Results**
The meeting link is missing from reminder emails, making it difficult for users to join the meeting directly from the reminder.
**Expected Results**
The reminder email should include the meeting link, ensuring users have all necessary details to join the meeting.

**Evidence**
Attached are screenshots of  the reminder email (without link).


![Screenshot 2024-11-30 192854](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e75a038a-beb0-4b76-9b04-50adb6b2b043)

issues.title: feat: [CAL-3584] Added zod schemas for app metadata living in config.json #…
issues.body: ## What does this PR do? This PR adds functionality to generate TypeScript metadata files (`metadata.generated.ts`) for both the apps and templates directories. The metadata is derived from the `config.json` files found within each app and template folder. The metadata files are auto-generated and contain the validated metadata according to the schema defined in `AppMetaSchema`. - Generates metadata for all apps and templates located in the `appsDir` and `templatesDir` respectively. - Each metadata file is auto-generated for the app or template, containing key information such as `name`, `slug`, `type`, and more. - Ensures that all generated metadata files are type-safe using Zod validation. on creating new app with `yarn app-store create`, metadata.generated.ts file will automatically generated. like below: - I have also updated the doc on https://cal.com/docs/developing/guides/appstore-and-integration/build-an-app#structure ### Fixes: - **Fixes CAL-3584** #14808 (Github Issue number) ## Mandatory Tasks (DO NOT REMOVE) - [x] I have self-reviewed the code (A decent size PR without self-review might be rejected). - [x] I have updated the developer docs in /docs if this PR makes changes that would require a [documentation change](https://cal.com/docs). If N/A, write N/A here and check the checkbox. - [ ] I confirm automated tests are in place that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works. ## How should this be tested? 1. generate a new app with `yarn app-store create` - Verify that the `metadata.generated.ts` files are created in app directory. - Check the contents of the generated files to ensure they contain the expected metadata fields (such as `name`, `slug`, etc.). - Ensure that no errors or warnings are logged during the script execution. 2. Test the output: - Inspect the generated `metadata.generated.ts` files for correctness. - Validate that the generated metadata matches the expected structure as defined by the `AppMetaSchema`.

issues.title: Option to Change Default Calendar on Team Event
issues.body:
### Is your proposal related to a problem?

<!--
  Provide a clear and concise description of what the problem is.
  For example, "I'm always frustrated when..."
-->

For serial entrepreneurs like myself, there is no calendar service that allows us to manage different businesses/teams inside one account. Right now, I own two companies, and I want to use two different custom domain emails as our calendars where we want team meetings to be booked. But I simply... CANNOT!

### Describe the solution you'd like

<!--
  Provide a clear and concise description of what you want to happen.
-->

Cal.com has been the closest to making this happen so far as it allows me to add events to a separate calendar, BUT this feature is only available for personal events (and not team events). Reference: https://cal.com/blog/v-3-8

Team events still only allow events to be added to the default calendar. This is such a bummer, and I feel it is a feature that Cal can achieve very easily. If this was allowed in team events, one account in Cal.com would enable entrepreneurs like myself who own multiple businesses to manage all calendars from one account. You can charge a higher price if needed, but this would be a very handy feature.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

<!--
  Let us know about other solutions you've tried or researched.
-->

N/A

issues.title: fix: cancel workflows on cancel booking
issues.body:
## What does this PR do?

- Fixes #17806  
- Fixes CAL-4779 

Removed deleteScheduledSend function in scheduledEmailRemainder cron api, as this lead to removing the cancelled label on the scheduled emails, thus causing the users to receive emails for cancelled event.

According to sendGrid docs : 

> When a Batch is canceled, all messages associated with that batch will stay in your sending queue, but when their send_at value is reached, they will be discarded instead of attempting delivery.

Link to SendGrid [docs](https://www.twilio.com/docs/sendgrid/for-developers/sending-email/stopping-a-scheduled-send#3-cancel-or-pause-your-send)

### Previously ( when deleteScheduledSend is present )

#### Event Created

![Screenshot from 2024-11-26 17-07-46](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eafde537-c94a-4b0c-bdd2-5fd8b73ff6ff)

#### Event Cancelled

![Screenshot from 2024-11-26 17-09-38](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/67f033c4-8937-4c0f-b4f4-f68af9fd03c4)

#### Simulated a Cron

Simulated a cron to execute deleteScheduledSend to delete emails in the queue.
https://github.com/calcom/cal.com/blob/main/packages/features/ee/workflows/api/scheduleEmailReminders.ts#L80

Ideally this cron action should have deleted the emails in the queue, and the users should not get any email regarding the cancelled booking

#### Email Received on Cancelled Booking

![Screenshot from 2024-11-26 17-30-54](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/173d9464-85cd-4212-9300-2c2eea3f482a)

Did not received SMS or Whatsapp Reminder, but still received email on the cancelled booking.

### Updated Changes ( deleteScheduledSend is removed )

#### Event Created
![Screenshot from 2024-11-26 18-08-25](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c712e17a-6350-4960-99a4-0f10a8f64c9e)

#### Event Cancelled
![Screenshot from 2024-11-26 18-09-14](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/46a36af9-c8a5-4252-90ea-81b07e80f463)

#### Again Simulated the cron
https://github.com/calcom/cal.com/blob/main/packages/features/ee/workflows/api/scheduleEmailReminders.ts#L80

#### No Emails received on Cancelled Booking
![Screenshot from 2024-11-26 18-31-14](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/96d398ec-6250-4503-80fb-e6b0c084940f)

No emails , SMS or Whatsapp reminder is received.

pull_requests.title: feat: [CAL-3584] Added zod schemas for app metadata living in config.json #…
pull_requests.body: ## What does this PR do? This PR adds functionality to generate TypeScript metadata files (`metadata.generated.ts`) for both the apps and templates directories. The metadata is derived from the `config.json` files found within each app and template folder. The metadata files are auto-generated and contain the validated metadata according to the schema defined in `AppMetaSchema`. - Generates metadata for all apps and templates located in the `appsDir` and `templatesDir` respectively. - Each metadata file is auto-generated for the app or template, containing key information such as `name`, `slug`, `type`, and more. - Ensures that all generated metadata files are type-safe using Zod validation. on creating new app with `yarn app-store create`, metadata.generated.ts file will automatically generated. like below: - I have also updated the doc on https://cal.com/docs/developing/guides/appstore-and-integration/build-an-app#structure ### Fixes: - **Fixes CAL-3584** #14808 (Github Issue number) ## Mandatory Tasks (DO NOT REMOVE) - [x] I have self-reviewed the code (A decent size PR without self-review might be rejected). - [x] I have updated the developer docs in /docs if this PR makes changes that would require a [documentation change](https://cal.com/docs). If N/A, write N/A here and check the checkbox. - [ ] I confirm automated tests are in place that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works. ## How should this be tested? 1. generate a new app with `yarn app-store create` - Verify that the `metadata.generated.ts` files are created in app directory. - Check the contents of the generated files to ensure they contain the expected metadata fields (such as `name`, `slug`, etc.). - Ensure that no errors or warnings are logged during the script execution. 2. Test the output: - Inspect the generated `metadata.generated.ts` files for correctness. - Validate that the generated metadata matches the expected structure as defined by the `AppMetaSchema`.

pull_requests.title: fix: cancel workflows on cancel booking
pull_requests.body:
## What does this PR do?

- Fixes #17806  
- Fixes CAL-4779 

Removed deleteScheduledSend function in scheduledEmailRemainder cron api, as this lead to removing the cancelled label on the scheduled emails, thus causing the users to receive emails for cancelled event.

According to sendGrid docs : 

> When a Batch is canceled, all messages associated with that batch will stay in your sending queue, but when their send_at value is reached, they will be discarded instead of attempting delivery.

Link to SendGrid [docs](https://www.twilio.com/docs/sendgrid/for-developers/sending-email/stopping-a-scheduled-send#3-cancel-or-pause-your-send)

### Previously ( when deleteScheduledSend is present )

#### Event Created

![Screenshot from 2024-11-26 17-07-46](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eafde537-c94a-4b0c-bdd2-5fd8b73ff6ff)

#### Event Cancelled

![Screenshot from 2024-11-26 17-09-38](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/67f033c4-8937-4c0f-b4f4-f68af9fd03c4)

#### Simulated a Cron

Simulated a cron to execute deleteScheduledSend to delete emails in the queue.
https://github.com/calcom/cal.com/blob/main/packages/features/ee/workflows/api/scheduleEmailReminders.ts#L80

Ideally this cron action should have deleted the emails in the queue, and the users should not get any email regarding the cancelled booking

#### Email Received on Cancelled Booking

![Screenshot from 2024-11-26 17-30-54](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/173d9464-85cd-4212-9300-2c2eea3f482a)

Did not received SMS or Whatsapp Reminder, but still received email on the cancelled booking.

### Updated Changes ( deleteScheduledSend is removed )

#### Event Created
![Screenshot from 2024-11-26 18-08-25](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c712e17a-6350-4960-99a4-0f10a8f64c9e)

#### Event Cancelled
![Screenshot from 2024-11-26 18-09-14](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/46a36af9-c8a5-4252-90ea-81b07e80f463)

#### Again Simulated the cron
https://github.com/calcom/cal.com/blob/main/packages/features/ee/workflows/api/scheduleEmailReminders.ts#L80

#### No Emails received on Cancelled Booking
![Screenshot from 2024-11-26 18-31-14](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/96d398ec-6250-4503-80fb-e6b0c084940f)

No emails , SMS or Whatsapp reminder is received.

pull_requests.title: fix: Change filters to correctly get the right bookingCounts
pull_requests.body:
## What does this PR do?

Drafting with self-review so it becomes clear what happened.

TODO: This needs tests (interplay of different filters)
TODO: Create safety net to re-open slots when no slots are found due to filters.

bookingCounts returned the booking counts of all hosts but also increased the count of other hosts if the checked host was an attendee on his Booking. This could decrease the minBookingCount considerably (as this may only happen once) - this was the root cause of the issue; but it would only be triggered if the host that was attended by the other checked host was also being checked.

This triggered "No available slots" when the host that suddenly was included was an old host (part of eventType.hosts, but no longer part of the team) as that old host would then be chosen as qualified host, as he was so far behind the other hosts and then result 0 slots because he wasn’t part of the routedMemberIds

## What does this PR do?

- Fixes #17839
- Fixes CAL-4796

## Mandatory Tasks (DO NOT REMOVE)

- [x] I have self-reviewed the code (A decent size PR without self-review might be rejected).
- [x] N/A - I have updated the developer docs in /docs if this PR makes changes that would require a [documentation change](https://cal.com/docs). If N/A, write N/A here and check the checkbox.
- [x] I confirm automated tests are in place that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works.

## How should this be tested?

- Ensure you can create an OOO entry even when your dates overlap and you've been set as the redirect for someone else's OOO
